thread.title: SEE IT: Morris Day, Bruno Mars perform Prince tribute at Grammys
thread.title_full: SEE IT: Morris Day, Bruno Mars perform Prince tribute at Grammys - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: SEE IT: Morris Day, Bruno Mars perform Prince tribute at Grammys
text:
The Grammys saved the Prince tribute for the end of the night and it was absolutely worth the wait.
Morris Day and The Time opened the performance with “Jungle Love” and “The Bird,” which were both produced by Prince under a pseudonym.
Bruno Mars, dressed like Prince, performed "Let's Go Crazy" during a tribute to the legendary singer at the Grammys. (Matt Sayles/Matt Sayles/Invision/AP) Bruno Mars, dressed in a sparkly purple suit and ruffled white shirt fit for a king, followed up with an incredible performance of Prince’s “Let’s Go Crazy.”
His solo guitar riff had the crowd on its feet as they danced to one of the singer’s most popular songs.
Grammys 2017 winners and losers 
Morris Day and Jerome Benton honored Prince with two of their songs he wrote. (Kevin Winter/Getty Images for NARAS) Prince died April 21 of an opioid overdose at his Paisley Park home in Minnesota after a legendary career.
Tags: grammys Send a Letter to the Editor
